instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2289: What is A2289? A2289 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3456, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01987..
definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.EDP_BKLT_PWM: What is EDP_BKLT_PWM? EDP_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message: Hello, MacBook 2020, initially it was flooded with the display connector, after which it turned on, but only through an external monitor. After replacing the <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>, the processor stopped turning on and warmed up, put it in its place, which it removed, everything is the same. Where to look? The board starts and turns off immediately

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message:
Why did you touch <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> if got external video?
Is the RAM voltage controller; you can't get any image, if had problems there.

"everything is the same"
Like before, or after <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> changed?
Re-check the job you did on <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> area.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message: Checked the same thing. What could be overheated in this area?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message: Still not clear if your board has external video now, or doesn't turn on at all...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message: The board does not have an external video, the processor does not heat up, I looked at everything in the places where it was doing the work, and found nothing. When you press the button, the fan starts spinning for a second and stops

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message: Can you put the machine in DFU mode now?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message: not

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message:
You did something wrong when you work at <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> area.

If machine responds now to power button, T2 works somehow.
Did you follow exact steps from DFU tutorial?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message: I do not know what kind of dfu tutorial, you can throw it off please

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message: Did everything as it says in the tutorial, it doesn't help

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message:
Something went wrong when replaced <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>.
Probably applied heat affected other areas; maybe corrosion under BGA chips..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message: I managed to turn on the MacBook, but there is no image, on the macbook 2020 is the display cable from the macbook 2017 suitable?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message:
Usually, cables and LCDs can be used for test.
However, ALWAYS check in schematics if the connectors have the same pinout.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message: Will the matrix from macbook 2017 fit him? and what could be the reason? L8504 burned out due to spilled water, restored it

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message:
L8504 usually gets burnt because of short inside LCD assembly; classic flexgate issue.
If J8500 was damaged by liquid, many times CPU eDP out is fired.
Sometime still gets external video, like in your case...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message: So can I throw a 2017 macbook display on it?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message:
Why don't you post first, diode mode readings (to ground) on EDP lines of J8500?
Start with <SIGNAL>EDP_AUXCH_N</SIGNAL>...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message: Can you please tell me which lines you need to call, otherwise so far there is not much experience in this

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message: on <SIGNAL>EDP_AUXCH_P</SIGNAL> 0.260v in resistance mode

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message: All EDP_ lines of J8500...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>EDP_AUXCH_N</SIGNAL> 0.503v
<SIGNAL>EDP_AUXCH_P</SIGNAL> 0.260v
<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> 0.821v 
is that all I could find, where to look for other lines?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message:
I can't believe you've seen <SIGNAL>EDP_AUXCH_N</SIGNAL>/P, but not <SIGNAL>EDP_ML_N</SIGNAL>/P lines.

However no need to check any more line.
The difference between <SIGNAL>EDP_AUXCH_N</SIGNAL>/P lines is big enough to show bad CPU...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stopped turning on
threads.message: that is, is there a problem in the processor?
